labels.analysis: The MCP Server specializes in downloading video and audio content from various platforms, with additional capabilities for handling subtitles. It primarily solves the problem of accessing and extracting multimedia content for offline use, supporting multiple formats, languages, and clean transcript extraction. The tools focus on media-specific operations, privacy-focused downloads, and content accessibility.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Media & Download Tools" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around downloading and processing video/audio content, which aligns closely with multimedia management. The secondary labels "Content Accessibility" and "Privacy Tools" were selected because the server emphasizes clean transcript extraction for accessibility and privacy-focused direct downloads without tracking. A custom label was not needed as the predefined categories cover the functionality well.

tools.name: list_subtitle_languages
tools.description: List all available subtitle languages and their formats for a video (including auto-generated captions)

tools.name: download_video_subtitles
tools.description: Download video subtitles in any available format. Supports both regular and auto-generated subtitles in various languages.

language.description: Language code (e.g., 'en', 'zh-Hant', 'ja'). Will try to get auto-generated subtitles if regular subtitles are not available.

tools.name: download_video
tools.description: Download video to the user's default Downloads folder (usually ~/Downloads).

resolution.description: Preferred video resolution. For YouTube: '480p', '720p', '1080p', 'best'. For other platforms: '480p' for low quality, '720p'/'1080p' for HD, 'best' for highest quality. Defaults to '720p'

tools.name: download_audio
tools.description: Download audio in best available quality (usually m4a/mp3 format) to the user's default Downloads folder (usually ~/Downloads).

tools.name: download_transcript
tools.description: Download and clean video subtitles to produce a plain text transcript without timestamps or formatting.

server_info_crawled.name: yt-dlp Video and Audio Downloader
server_info_crawled.author: @daniellopez-2/youtube-download
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable LLMs to download video and audio content from popular platforms like YouTube, Facebook, and TikTok with resolution and subtitle options. Provide subtitle downloads in multiple languages and clean transcript extraction for enhanced content accessibility. Ensure privacy-focused direct downloads without tracking, seamlessly integrating with MCP-compatible LLMs.

tools.name: list_subtitle_languages
tools.description: List all available subtitle languages and their formats for a video (including auto-generated captions)

tools.name: download_video_subtitles
tools.description: Download video subtitles in any available format. Supports both regular and auto-generated subtitles in various languages.

language.description: Language code (e.g., 'en', 'zh-Hant', 'ja'). Will try to get auto-generated subtitles if regular subtitles are not available.

tools.name: download_video
tools.description: Download video to the user's default Downloads folder (usually ~/Downloads).

resolution.description: Preferred video resolution. For YouTube: '480p', '720p', '1080p', 'best'. For other platforms: '480p' for low quality, '720p'/'1080p' for HD, 'best' for highest quality. Defaults to '720p'

tools.name: download_audio
tools.description: Download audio in best available quality (usually m4a/mp3 format) to the user's default Downloads folder (usually ~/Downloads).

tools.name: download_transcript
tools.description: Download and clean video subtitles to produce a plain text transcript without timestamps or formatting.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@daniellopez-2/youtube-download/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
